name: BookSyNation
label: /assets/bookcine-label.svg
description: BookSyNation is a cross platform application developed using Flutter and Firebase. This app is a vaccination booking system intended to facilitate autonomous and efficient  vaccinations. BookSyNation was developed as part of our Software Design Track Course 1. The project comes with software engineering solutions and documentations to facilitate our development of the application.
challenges: Creating an app that works on multiple platforms is not easy, especially since we only had about two months to make this app fully functional. Not only did we have to finish the application within that time frame, but we also had to create various software documentations and project management plans.
solutions: We were successful in achieving this by organizing our efforts around specific goals and making use of cutting-edge development tools to improve our ability to communicate and write code in collaboration. One of the most important contributors to our timely completion of the project was the fact that we adhered strictly to our project management plan.
role: I was the primary UI/UX designer for both the web and desktop versions of this application and served as the lead front-end developer during our application's development stage.
skills: During the course of developing this application, I was able to improve my skills in cross-platform implementations and learn new approaches to frontend development. My interest in learning more contemporary programming languages has been stoked thanks to this project, which is what first got me interested in Flutter.

name: WhiteList Inc.
label: /assets/whitelist-label.svg
description: WhiteList is a centralized informational display hub of various rentable locations within Cebu. The website was developed using React-JS, HTML, and CSS along with Firebase as its authentication and database solution.
challenges: This website was the first project that my current development team worked on together as a group. My teammates were relatively unfamiliar with the languages that we used, which resulted to a steeper learning curve for our team.
solutions: In order to close the technical gaps that existed within our team, we ran onboarding classes in addition to mentoring sessions. During the development process, we also established a robust communication channel so that everyone involved could encourage one another to openly voice their concerns.
role: WhiteList is one of the projects that I spearheaded. During the whole course of this website, I served as the lead developer and project manager of our team. I took charge of the application's design as well as led the team with the project development.
skills: As the senior and lead developer of our team, I was responsible for conducting the tutorial and mentoring sessions we had. My knowledge about full-stack development expanded as well as my leadership and project management skills thanks to the experience I gained while working on this project.

name: AltruWiz
label: /assets/altruwiz-label.svg
description: Altruwiz is an ongoing website that our team is working on using React-Typescript, SCSS, and Firebase. This website is developed to complement community service activities and initiatives with entertaining gaming mechanics. This app assists individuals and organizations in tracking, creating, and promoting community events.
challenges: During our development stage, we had several concurrent projects and deliverables that required our time and attention. This circumstance challenged our priorities and commitment to the project.
solutions: Our team was able to adapt our work schedule to better suit everyone's needs. This was possible by establishing a better sense of unity and collaboration. Understanding one another and working as a team was our greatest tool in overcoming the situation.
role: AlruWiz is one of my most recent projects for which I serve as the senior and lead frontend developer. I also assisted the application's design stage as the co-UI/UX designer.
skills: This project allowed me to explore and discover new approaches to my work pattern, allowing me to effectively manage my time, efforts, and focus.

name: Datagrades v1.0
label: /assets/datagradesv1-label.svg
description: Datagrades is a desktop grade management tool that I designed to replace the convential class record sheets and tasky spreadsheets used for grade tabulation. The software includes automated grade calculation, reviewing, submission, and dissemination.
challenges: As this was my first project involving advanced database concepts, it was a challenge for me to handle large projects early on. Being the sole programmer on the team was the most difficult part of creating this project.
solutions: With the help of very supportive mentors in our institution, I was able to apply a lot of advance concepts to my craft. Doing the tasks I need to acomplish was a lot easier as I applied the concepts and workarounds they have taught me to my coding.
role: During its development stage, I was the sole full-stack developer of our team as well as the co-researcher of our thesis paper.
skills: All thanks to this project, I was able to learn how to work under pressure with grace. I also learned a lot from my mentors especially with the technical parts of databasse handling and software programming.

name: Datagrades v2.0
label: /assets/datagrades-label.svg
description: Datagrades v2.0 is the modern application of my grade management tool application called Datagrades v1, this software design was made to incorporate cross-platform implementations to the app and make it accessible through the internet.
challenges: Adapting a desktop application into the modern cross platform application was our main priority in this design. The design involved software engineering principles and was presented a small group of teachers for evaluation.
solutions: We continuously improved our designs according to the comments and suggestions of our respondents. We also systemend our design to be as intuitive as possible to our targeted users.
role: I served as the lead UI designer of our team as well as taking part in conceptualizing the architecture and software specifications of the design.
skills: During the development of this software design, I was able to hone my skills in project prototyping, project management, and software development planning.

name: InTeleTraf
label: /assets/inteletraf-label.svg
description: Inteletraf is a concept project that was pitched as one of the best project idea for our Technoprenueship class. It is a sophisticated Internet of Things (IOT) traffic system that was developed using engineering principles with software application prototypes.
challenges: During the process of developing this project, we were only given a month of time to produce a high-fidelity design, a 3D model, and project specification documents.
solutions: We managed to pull this through by making use of modern tools to aid our productivity as well as establishing better communication within the team.
role: Intelletraf is a concept project idea that I have pitched in my Technoprenuership course. I was the CEO of my team that lead the development of the project's design as well as its 3D models.
skills: My abilities in communication and public speaking have been greatly improved thanks to this project, which has also taught me a lot about pitching projects. In addition, the project gave me the opportunity to improve my project designing, particularly with regard to 3d models.

name: Cyberclock
label: /assets/cyberclock-label.svg
description: Cyberclock is a concept smart wall clock that I designed for a day out of hobby. The clock comes with a mobile application which I designed together with the 3d model of the device.
challenges: Building the 3d model and coming up with the concept of the project was the most tasky part of this concept product.
solutions: I am able to create the designs by searching for ideas on the internet regarding both the software application and the 3d models. During the difficult times, Dribble has been one of my closest friends.
skills: With the help of this project, I was able to significantly improve my skills in rapid prototyping and fast project conceptualization.
role: Because Cyberclock is a personal project that I worked on in my spare time, I was the sole designer of both the software and the 3D models that it contains.
